My Democratic colleagues should join @SenateGOP and @POTUS to enact #taxreform legislation in the coming weeks.
#WV’s economy is poised for growth, and #taxreform is a major opportunity to give it a boost.

That’s people like the 70-year old retired postal worker from @CityofWheeling who wrote to me saying, “the Senate needs to get these tax cuts and tax reform done, and done quickly.” I couldn’t agree more.
The average middle-income family in #WV would gain $1,952 in after tax income because of @SenateGOP #taxreform bill and approximately 4,700 jobs will be created.
This is about giving middle-class families more income to spend now or save for retirement, and Americans in every income category will benefit.
This is about growing small bizs, raising wages, making American companies more competitive globally and creating more jobs in the U.S.
The goals we’ve outlined for #taxreform are shared by many Americans and will make a real difference for West Virginians.

For WVians & Americans, the status quo isn’t working & #taxreform is our opportunity to change it.
#Taxreform also provides us a chance to give our small bizs the resources they need to expand, to create jobs & to raise wages.
#Taxreform will put more money in their pockets so they can decide the best way to spend it.
#Taxreform provides us an incredible opportunity to make a real, tangible difference in the lives of American families.
Many in #WV have been hit hard by a struggling economy & we aren’t alone. Roughly ½ of American families are living paycheck to paycheck.
#taxreform is important for anyone who has dreamed of owning a small biz & for every American trying to get ahead.

#TaxReform is the change WV needs to revitalize communities & increase economic growth that creates opportunity for future generations.
#TaxReform will enhance growth & provide more job opportunities for Americans.

For the good of the nation & for the good of the Senate, there should be no filibuster of Judge Gorsuch.
I hope my Dem colleagues will recognize the need to invoke cloture on Judge Gorsuch’s nomination.
Judge Gorsuch is a mainstream judge who has earned the respect of his judicial colleagues.
The Senate has a very clear history of rejecting the use of the filibuster against #SCOTUS nominations.
A filibuster of a nominee like Judge Gorsuch would be a tremendous mistake & would harm the Senate as an institution.
.@TheJournalWV echoed these words saying Judge Gorsuch will decide cases regardless of his own preferences
.@IntelligencerWV editorial highlights that Judge Gorsuch is faithful to the #Constitution, not ideology.
Recent @DM_opinion editorial supports Judge Gorsuch’s confirmation & believes he has the strong understanding & respect for our Constitution
It’s clear from our mtg, a thorough examination of his record & watching last wks hearing, that Judge Gorsuch will rule fairly.
Judge Gorsuch has been through the Senate confirmation process before when he was approved to the 10th circuit w/out opposition.
Judge Scalia left behind a legacy of faithfully applying the law & Judge Gorsuch is a worthy successor.

Let’s seize this opportunity & come together to support needed infrastructure improvements that invest in our communities
#WRDA modernizes water transportation infrastructure, addresses flood protection & environmental restoration needs
WV rivers provide commercial transport & recreational opportunities – #WRDA can help maximize the use of those waterways
#WRDA also looks at our drinking water infrastructure, including issues that followed 2014 Elk River spill
#WRDA addresses dam safety, including the 422 high hazard dams in WV
#wvflood caused economic devastation that will take years to recover – #WRDA will look at implementing flood risk management projects
Here’s how: #WRDA contains provisions that can help prevent catastrophic damages & loss of life like what we saw during #wvflood

Thanks for watching. For more info on the #MinersProtectionAct, visit http://1.usa.gov/28MgUzS
I’ll continue working w/ my colleagues to see the #MinersProtectionAct become law before it’s too late
This is truly bipartisan legislation – supporters of this bill recognize that we owe it to these retirees to fulfill our commitment
The #MinersProtectionAct benefits taxpayers, beneficiaries & coal communities in WV & across country
If we don’t act now, 21,000+ miners & their families who depend on these benefits will lose their health care at end of 2016
So we must take up & pass the #MinersProtectionAct – an important bill for our nation’s coal mining families
Our selfless coal miners have powered America for generations & mining is at the center of WV’s history & economy.

With my support, the Senate advanced #CARA, a needed step to help communities combat the growing drug epidemic:pic.twitter.com/KcomjnhJiQ
We are in jeopardy of losing a generation if we don’t address this crisis now.
By working together, we can change these statistics and prevent more tragedies from occurring.
Efforts like #CARA are just the first steps. There is much more work ahead for all of us.
These amendments would prevent addiction, promote recovery and curb drug addiction in WV & nationally
I plan to introduce several amendments to help strengthen this important bill & create a #DrugFreeWV
#CARA represents a positive step forward in addressing the opioid crisis
The bipartisan #CARA addresses the opioid epidemic by expanding prevention & education & promotes treatment resources
We’ve taken steps to address the drug epidemic & I hope the Senate will begin debate on #CARA today.
We should ALL agree on 1 thing: we must act to change these horrifying statistics & save lives.
Drug addiction is a disease that knows no boundaries & WV is not alone in this fight.
Unfortunately, WV leads the nation in drug-related overdose deaths – more than 2x the nat’l average.
Since 2000, drug overdose deaths have increased by 137%.

Passing these resolutions sends a message to the world that the American people don’t stand behind #POTUS’s economically catastrophic regs
Congress now has an opportunity to express concerns w/ these carbon mandates & weigh in about whether these regs should go into effect.
DC policies that pit one state vs. another, & prioritize certain communities & certain jobs vs. others bring livelihoods of many to a halt
Policies that are ripping the American Dream away from families and communities.
Policies that help some states & hurt others. Policies that target states like #WV, which produce affordable & reliable energy.
It’s the reality that the policies emanating from #POTUS – our own government – are causing this destruction.
These regs have far reaching negative effects on schools, home values, electricity bills, & funding for public safety & law enforcement.
The reality of the families, the faces, the hardships, thousands of layoff notices issued, & jobs that have been lost.
I've expressed these same frustrations before. The difference today is the reality of what we are facing w/ these new carbon regulations.
I rise today on behalf of WV’s wrkers, families & communities-& all middle class Americans who will bear the burden of these carbon mandates

ICYMI: I delivered my maiden speech on the @SenateFloor today. Watch the video here: http://bit.ly/1MqLWaa .
After receiving many comments from Congress & others on its proposal, @ATFHQ does the right thing for American sportsmen & pulls ammo ban
Fighting for West Virginians always has and always will be my top priority.
There will be differences of opinion and philosophy along the way, but Americans expect that we bridge those gaps.
I am optimistic that we can find solutions that move our country forward.
We need improved energy infrastructure in order to make full use of these gas reserves.
As a child of Marshall Co., the heart of Marcellus Shale development in WV, I’m delighted to see this community come alive with opportunity
We must continue to support important research at Morgantown’s National Energy Technology Lab.
While @EPA’s proposed GHG standards are misguided, we should continue to make the use of fossil fuel cleaner and more efficient.
As Chair of the Subcmte on Clean Air & Nuclear Safety, I will lead the fight against excessive regs that have been devastating to my state.
In WV, the attack on coal mines reduces revenues for education programs, roads & other public services.
Anti-coal policies impact more than miners & their families.
The administration’s overreach has contributed to thousands of coal miners losing their jobs in WV & our neighboring states.
Finally, and of critical importance to West Virginia and the country, we need to work together to implement a commonsense #energy policy.
I am encouraged that senators in both parties have recognized the importance of funding for the bipartisan S-CHIP program.
I started my legislative career in the WV House of Delegates, where I served on the committee that first implemented S-CHIP in our state.
Expanded access to private medical providers will help improve the quality of care that we offer to our veterans.
While we have made strides to improve access for our veterans, the current program is not working as well as it should. More must be done.
But we have to recognize that there is a role for government in helping broadband reach hard-to-serve communities.
Too much government control will be counterproductive, choking off private sector expansion projects and hindering new technologies.
High-speed internet access is a pillar of our 21st Century infrastructure and a gateway to economic growth in rural America.
I am committed to expanding access to broadband in communities across West Virginia and will be a champion for connecting our state.
Our states need certainty to invest in their transportation infrastructure.  That certainty comes from a long-term transportation bill.
Addressing our country's crumbling infrastructure is an area that can bridge the partisan divide and further economic growth.
Today I will outline how I plan to produce bipartisan, commonsense solutions in the United States Senate to make WV communities stronger.
As @SenateMajLdr Mitch McConnell has stated, to do this the Senate must work more, have an open amendment process and take tough votes (2/2)
I have heard a clear message from WVians: improve economic opportunities for our state, stop the bickering & fight for our jobs. (1/2)
I look forward to continuing to work with my friend @Sen_JoeManchin in the months ahead.
West Virginians expect the United States Senate to find pragmatic solutions to the momentous problems confronting our country.
To serve as West Virginia’s first female Senator is a true honor and one that comes with great responsibility.
